identificationModule.briefTitle: Bioequivalence Study of Saxagliptin and Glucophage Combination Formulations in Healthy Subjects (A)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Bioequivalence Study of the Fixed Dose Combination of 2.5 mg Saxagliptin and 500 mg Metformin Immediate Release (IR) Tablet Relative to 2.5 mg Saxagliptin Tablet and 500 mg Metformin IR Tablet Co-administered to Healthy Subjects in a Fasted and in a Fed State

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To demonstrate bioequivalence of a 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin (glucophage) immediate release (IR) fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet to the 2.5 mg saxagliptin tablet and 500 mg metformin IR tablet co-administered to healthy subjects in a fasted and in a fed state.

armGroups.label: S+ M, (fasted)> S/M (fed)> S/M (fasted)>S+M (fed)
armGroups.description: Participants were randomized to receive oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin plus a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions (S + M \[fasted\]) followed by a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions (S/M \[fed\]) followed by S/M under fasting conditions (S/M \[fasted\]) followed by S + M under fed conditions (S + M \[fed\])
interventionNames: Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fasted
Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fed

armGroups.label: S/M (fasted)> S+M (fasted)> S+M (fed)> S/M (fed)
armGroups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S/M (fasted) followed by S + M (fasted) followed by S + M (fed) followed by S/M (fed)
interventionNames: Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fasted
Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fed

armGroups.label: S+M (fed)> S/M (fasted) >S/M (fed)> S+M (fasted)
armGroups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S + M (fed) followed by S/M (fasted) followed by S/M (fed) followed by S+M (fasted)
interventionNames: Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fasted
Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fed

armGroups.label: S/M (fed)> S+M (fed)> S+M (fasted)> S/M (fasted)
armGroups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S/M (fed) followed by S+M (fed) followed by S+M (fasted) followed by S/M (fasted)
interventionNames: Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fasted
Drug: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fed

interventions.name: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fasted
interventions.description: Participants received oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions

interventions.name: Saxagliptin/Metformin, Fasting
interventions.description: Participants received a single oral dose of a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fasting conditions

interventions.name: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR, Fed
interventions.description: Participants received oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fed conditions

interventions.name: Saxagliptin/Metformin, Fed
interventions.description: Participants received a single oral dose of a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With at Least 1 Adverse Event (AE), Death, Serious AE (SAE), or AEs Leading to Discontinuation
secondaryOutcomes.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Day 1 through Day 45, including up to 56 days after last dose of study medication

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Marked Abnormalities
secondaryOutcomes.description: High=greater than Upper Normal Limit (ULN), Low=lower than Lower Normal Limit (LLN). LLN/ULN= Leukocytes: \<0.9 x LLN/ \>1.2 x ULN; blood urea nitrogen (BUN): \>1.1 x ULN; creatinine: \>1.33 x BL; phosphorous (P): \<0.75 x LLN/ \>1.2 5 x ULN; creatinine kinase (CK): \>1.5 x ULN; urine blood=use ≥2 x BL if value ≥2+ or BL1+
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Day 1 through Day 45, including up to 56 days after last dose of study medication

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
secondaryOutcomes.description: PR interval, QRS complex, width of QRS, QT interval, and QT corrected for heart rate adjusting for heart rate using either Bazett formula or Fridericia formula were measured. ECG abnormalities were judged to be of medical importance by the Investigator.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Period 1 Day 1, Period 2 Day 1, Period 3 Day 1, Period 4 Day 1, Period 4 Day 3

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Vital Sign Abnormalities
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, respiration, and temperature were assessed.Vital sign abnormalities abnormalities were judged to be of medical importance by the Investigator.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Period 1 Day 1, Period 2 Day 1, Period 3 Day 1, Period 4 Day 1, Period 4 Day 3

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participant With Clinically Relevant Physical Examination Abnormalities
secondaryOutcomes.description: A physical examination was conducted which included height and weight measurements, from which the Body Mass Index was determined. Physical examination abnormalities were judged to be of medical importance by the Investigator.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Screen, Period 1 Day -1, prior to discharge

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Men and women ages 19 to 45 inclusive
* Healthy subjects as determined by no clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, electrocardiograms (ECGs), and clinical laboratory determinations
* Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 32 kg/m2, inclusive. BMI = weight (kg)/ \[height (m)\]2

Exclusion Criteria:

* Women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP) who are unwilling or unable to use acceptable barrier methods (condoms and spermicides) to avoid pregnancy for the entire study period and for up to 8 weeks after the last dose of investigational product
* Any significant acute or chronic medical illness
* Current or recent (within 3 months) gastrointestinal disease
* Any major surgery within 4 weeks of study drug administration
* History of allergy to Dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) inhibitor or related compounds
* History of allergy or intolerance to metformin or other similar acting agents
* Prior exposure to saxagliptin
* Prior exposure to metformin within 3 months of study drug administration.
* Estimated creatinine clearance (Clcr) of \< 80ml/min using the Cockcroft Gault formula

references.citation: Upreti VV, Keung CF, Boulton DW, Chang M, Li L, Tang A, Hsiang BC, Quamina-Edghill D, Frevert EU, Lacreta FP. Bioequivalence of saxagliptin/metformin immediate release (IR) fixed-dose combination tablets and single-component saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets in healthy adult subjects. Clin Drug Investig. 2013 May;33(5):365-74. doi: 10.1007/s40261-013-0075-z.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: 85 participants were enrolled and 24 were treated on study. 61 participants discontinued before randomization and treatment due to: no longer meeting study criteria (n=36), withdraw of consent (n=3), study was full (n=15), participant did not call for results (n=1), completed alternate status (n=5), or did not show for check-up (n=1)

groups.title: S+M (Fasted)> S/M (Fed)> S/M (Fasted)>S+M (Fed)
groups.description: Participants were randomized to receive oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin plus a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions (S + M \[fasted\]) followed by a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions (S/M \[fed\]) followed by S/M under fasting conditions (S/M \[fasted\]) followed by S + M under fed conditions (S + M \[fed\])

groups.title: S/M (Fasted)> S+M (Fasted)> S+M (Fed)> S/M (Fed)
groups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S/M (fasted) followed by S + M (fasted) followed by S + M (fed) followed by S/M (fed)

groups.title: S+M (Fed)> S/M (Fasted) >S/M (Fed)> S+M (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S + M (fed) followed by S/M (fasted) followed by S/M (fed) followed by S+M (fasted)

groups.title: S/M (Fed)> S+M (Fed)> S+M (Fasted)> S/M (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants were randomized to receive S/M (fed) followed by S+M (fed) followed by S+M (fasted) followed by S/M (fasted)

groups.title: All Treated Participants
groups.description: Participants were randomized to received 1 of 4 treatments 1)oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions, 2) a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fasting conditions, 3) oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fed conditions, or 4) a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions. Participants received all 4 treatments in 1 of 4 sequences: 1-4-2-3, 2-1-3-4, 3-2-4-1, or 4-3-1-2, with a washout period between treatments of at least 1 week.

outcomeMeasures.title: Saxagliptin Mean Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcomeMeasures.description: Cmax of single-dose saxagliptin (2.5 mg), either coadministered with metformin IR (500 mg), or administered as FDC 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR, under fasted and fed conditions.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: PK data set, all participants who received study drug
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Day 1: 0 hr, 0.25 hr, 0.5 hr, 0.75 hr, 1 hr, 1.5 hr, 2 hr, 3 hr, 4 hr, 6 hr, 8 hr, 12 hr, 18 hr, Day 2: 0 hr, 12 hr, Day 3: 0 hr

groups.title: Coadministration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants received oral coadministration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions

groups.title: Saxagliptin/Metformin FDC (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants received a single oral dose of a fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fasting conditions

groups.title: Coadministration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR (Fed)
groups.description: Participants received oral coadministration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin IR under fed conditions

groups.title: Saxagliptin/Metformin FDC (Fed)
groups.description: Participants received a single oral dose of an FDC tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate bioequivalence (BE) of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fasted state, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log(Cmax) of saxagliptin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of saxagliptin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fasted condition), then 20 subjects provided 97% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of saxagliptin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 93% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of saxagliptin.
analyses.statisticalComment: Bioequivalence=90% confidence intervals (CIs) for the test
analyses.paramType: Geometric Mean Ratio, Test vs. Reference
analyses.estimateComment: For Cmax of saxagliptin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fasted state: the geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fasted state

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate BE of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fed state, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log(Cmax) of saxagliptin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of saxagliptin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fed condition), then 20 subjects provided 97% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of saxagliptin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 93% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of saxagliptin.
analyses.paramType: Geometric Mean Ratio, Test vs Reference
analyses.estimateComment: For Cmax of saxagliptin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fed state: the geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fed state

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate BE of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fasted and fed states, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log\[AUC(0-T)\] of saxagliptin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of saxagliptin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fasted condition), then 20 subjects provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to AUC(INF) of saxagliptin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to AUC(INF) of saxagliptin.
analyses.paramType: Geometric Mean Ratio, Test vs. Reference
analyses.estimateComment: For AUC(0-T) of saxagliptin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fasted state: geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fasted state

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate BE of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fed state, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log\[AUC(0-T)\] of saxagliptin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of saxagliptin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fed condition), then 20 subjects provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to AUC(INF) of saxagliptin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to AUC(INF) of saxagliptin.
analyses.estimateComment: For AUC(0-T) of saxagliptin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fed state: the geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fed state

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate BE of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fasted state, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log(Cmax) of metformin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of metformin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fasted and fed), then 20 subjects provided 98% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of metformin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 93% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of metformin, respectively.
analyses.paramType: Geometric Mean Ratio, Test vs. Reference
analyses.estimateComment: For Cmax of metformin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fasted state: geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fasted fed state

analyses.groupDescription: To demonstrate BE of FDC tablets (Test) versus co-administration of saxagliptin and metformin IR tablets (Reference) formulations in fed state, linear mixed model analysis was performed on log(Cmax) of metformin. Factors in the model were sequence, period and treatment as fixed effects, and participant within sequence as a random effect.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: If no difference between bioavailabilities of metformin from FDC tablet vs. co-administration of saxagliptin tablet and metformin (fed), then 20 subjects provided 98% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of metformin. If 5% difference then 20 subjects provided 93% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax of metformin.
analyses.paramType: Geometric Mean Ratio, Test vs. Reference
analyses.estimateComment: For Cmax of metformin, the point estimate and 90% CI were calculated for the ratio of the geometric mean of the Test formulation in fed state: the geometric mean of the Reference formulation in fed state

outcomeMeasures.description: AUC (0-T for single-dose metformin (500 mg), either coadministered with saxagliptin (2.5 mg) or administerd as FDC 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR, under fasted and fed conditions.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With at Least 1 Adverse Event (AE), Death, Serious AE (SAE), or AEs Leading to Discontinuation
outcomeMeasures.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: From Day 1 through Day 45, including up to 56 days after last dose of study medication

groups.title: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants received oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions

groups.title: Saxagliptin/Metformin (Fasted)
groups.description: Participants received a single oral dose of a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fasting conditions

groups.title: Co-administration of Saxagliptin and Metformin IR (Fed)
groups.description: Participants received oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fed conditions

groups.title: Saxagliptin/Metformin (Fed)
groups.description: Participants received a single oral dose of a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions

groups.title: All Treated Participants
groups.description: Participants were randomized to received 1 of 4 treatments 1)oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fasted conditions, 2) a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fasting conditions, 3) oral co-administration of a 2.5 mg tablet of saxagliptin and a 500 mg tablet of metformin immediate release (IR) under fed conditions, or 4) a fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet of 2.5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin IR under fed conditions. Participants received all 4 treatments in 1 of 4 sequences: 1-4-2-3, 2-1-3-4, 3-2-4-1, or 4-3-1-2, with a washout period between treatments of at least 1 week.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Laboratory Marked Abnormalities
outcomeMeasures.description: High=greater than Upper Normal Limit (ULN), Low=lower than Lower Normal Limit (LLN). LLN/ULN= Leukocytes: \<0.9 x LLN/ \>1.2 x ULN; blood urea nitrogen (BUN): \>1.1 x ULN; creatinine: \>1.33 x BL; phosphorous (P): \<0.75 x LLN/ \>1.2 5 x ULN; creatinine kinase (CK): \>1.5 x ULN; urine blood=use ≥2 x BL if value ≥2+ or BL1+
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: From Day 1 through Day 45, including up to 56 days after last dose of study medication

Participants received all 4 treatments in 1 of 4 sequences: 1-4-2-3, 2-1-3-4, 3-2-4-1, or 4-3-1-2, with a washout period between treatments of at least 1 week.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
outcomeMeasures.description: PR interval, QRS complex, width of QRS, QT interval, and QT corrected for heart rate adjusting for heart rate using either Bazett formula or Fridericia formula were measured. ECG abnormalities were judged to be of medical importance by the Investigator.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Period 1 Day 1, Period 2 Day 1, Period 3 Day 1, Period 4 Day 1, Period 4 Day 3

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
